name: bismark
text: I've always imagined Beef's "OOOOHHHHH SSSSHHHIIIITTTT" to be a loud whisper, not a yell. Like something you'd say in surprise when eavesdropping. Anyone else?

name: wehavemagnums
text: Agreed!

name: chaesar
text: hell yes, you get a chubby

name: c_dizzle
text: Obv. 1 chubby for you.

name: erinye
text: I will also second (okay, fifth) this statement, since I have no other clever addition.

name: tasteful
text: chubby for the ill-fated eye

name: benet
text: Most definitely. His face expression and the way he grabs his head makes this all very clear.

name: genequagmire
text: Not at all.   Maybe if it was in italics as opposed to all caps.  Caps is yelling in my corner of the world.

name: genequagmire
text: On second look, it does appear to be in italics.  On that basis, maybe.  I think caps overrides italics, though.

name: sugadiabeetus
text: I got you to 200. Do I win something?

name: chrisb
text: Roast Beef, America's Poet

name: agika
text: The imagery is quite vivid...but I don't get it...

name: chaesar
text: apocalyptic cyberpunk dystopia, the kind of thing a depressive computer programmer would dream of

name: zefiel
text: I agree, but to my mind it seemed like a kickass set of Bond Gadgets that he would use to kill someone over at the Olive Garden.

name: spinynorman
text:
I kind of got to wonder who James Bond would need to kill at Olive Garden. I mean, the guy's skipping around to places in Monaco and Vegas and Switzerland... And then in one movie he gets in his Aston Marton and follows a Honda Civic to Olive Garden, next to the Burger Jerk and the Washateria at the strip mall, and as his mark orders a seven dollar plate of ravioli Bond uses his watch laser to vaporize his face.

Bond, of course, would be shocked to learn that Olive Garden not only does not have martinis, neither shaken nor stirred, but does not have very much in the way of hard liquor at all. The strip mall charged too much for the liquor license.

name: gormster
text: Does Bond do assassinations? I thought he did, you know, more search-and-rescue type stuff.

name: spinynorman
text:
I believe in the latest movie when told of a target he immediately said, "Do you want a clean kill, or do you want to send a message?"

I would say that's a yes.

name: relaxing
text: He has a licence to kill, after all.

name: theguitarhero
text: Yes but I don't think he's ever used it on non-targets.

name: i_love_kate
text: Tell that to legions of faceless security guards.

name: senseihollywood
text: you're thinking of Ahhnold as "Dutch" from Predator...

name: scraggg
text:
[IMGS OFF]
THERE'S A BOMB IN THE LASAGNA

name: laserblade
text: This deserves more chubbies.  Ah, vintage Doug.  One of my top five formative influences.

name: gournal
text: I am so glad that scragg is a person

name: senseihollywood
text: No, Mr. Bond, I expect you to...pass me another delicious breadstick!

name: paperboy_2000
text: I'll be serving you today, Mr. Bond.  My name is Pasta Galore.

name: belgand
text:
I was literally laughing for a solid minutes, tear streaming down my face. One chubby isn't enough.

Incidentally, can you even get ravioli at Olive Garden for $7? I always seemed to recall that they were not just crappy, but unreasonably pricey for the quality of food. More like $9-12 at least.

name: rumblefish
text: I believe their pricing system is based on how long the given meal takes to microwave. Ravioli is pretty dense so it takes longer to defrost hence the "high-roller" $9-12 price bracket.

name: rumblefish
text: This would pretty much be the movie where the script writer and the director look at each other during the first screening and realise that they may have taken the gritty realism thing a little too far.

name: gournal
text: Just mowing us all down

name: bookofsand
text: Thank you. I used to feel so alone.

name: nabeel84
text: Beef is not into meals. Because as this poem shows, he sees them as potential weapons, and are dangerous.

name: qwerty
text: A comment left by qwerty was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by radarjammer, Carpetbag, scrumpton, VictoriaW, Tangram)

name: awko
text: You can have yourself a chubby for the avatar/text combo. Brilliant.

name: radarjammer
text: Arnold and beef have very different "oh shit"s. Ah-nold just belts it through his meaty pipes as hard as he can; beef's is much more of a stuttered, choppy whisper.

name: senseihollywood
text: it's not poetry, he's reading the menu from Lonis F. Edison's family restaurant...

name: straw
text: This is a genuine fear of Beef's.  Look at his face.  He knows that someday this will happen to him and it will be terrible.

name: jyuu
text: This strip makes me hungry.

name: pa_ass_nts
text: My favourite, I think.

name: dumase
text: Existenzzzzz

name: charchar
text: One day, I will read poetry at open-mic night. Everyone will clap and as i walk away I will toss my cigarette over my shoulder and mutter, "This is for you, Beef"

name: zefiel
text:
ash all falling on an old lady's hat, setting it on fire

stub burning a puppy's eye

all hot flaming blood spraying on the mayor

name: charchar
text: NOT THE MAYOR! What sort of fool do you take me for?

name: dasuta
text: I always envisioned the 6th panel as being the full gravity of the situation slushing down onto poor beef's head.  He didn't know what he was getting into.

name: canusdivinus
text: Someone needs to make these things. Hella get weapons through security that way.

name: dj_douche
text: Damn Beef's poetry is better than about anything you'll see at most open mike nights. His delivery in the last panel is so heartfelt, that's what makes it all real.

name: aseidel
text: I'm scared.

name: carlyle
text: The greatest spy gadgets ever.

name: vulpes-aurum
text: And the cake... it's a lie. CB
